body:
confirmed.

This method should throw an exception when the $key does not exist in the object / array (shown by the corresponding tests)

> should throw an exception when the $key does not exist in the object / array (shown by the corresponding tests)

Does not sound right to me and not found in tests.

@SilverFire
What is the rationale for not erroring out when first argument is neither array nor an object? IMO when this method is called like this it means something not right and it is better if it manifests with error than silently works in a way that does not really makes sense.
Erroring for non-array will break BC for cases, when `$array` is null, for example.

> Does not sound right to me and not found in tests.
1. https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/tests/framework/helpers/ArrayHelperTest.php#L719
2. https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/tests/framework/helpers/ArrayHelperTest.php#L729
It's an error thrown by object of `Post1` class as a result of access to property that does not exist
it was added in 9e66e08bc7ee3480504418f011150a76c94b9782 (#802) not sure why. seems accidentally added.

Digging into this again I found that the last `return $default;` is not added by accident but is valid for retrieval of nested items, e.g. `getValue($array, 'test.name', 'default');` should return 'default' if the key `test` does not exist but also if `name` does not exist in `test`. However this allows weird things like:

```php
$array = [];
getValue($array, 'test.name', ['name' => 'hi']); // returns "hi"
```

I think this should be refactored and tested better in 2.1.

I'd add an exception for now.

issue.title: fix ArrayHelper::getValue() to throw exception on invalid input

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | only if people program against the documentation. result was kind of undefined. See #12927 
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #12927

fixes #12927

body:
@filipchuk this change is already considered as BC breaking, thank you for confirmation. 

Related: https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/issues/13248
